title: My $1,300 "Senior Computer" (I Want My Money Back!) - Krazy Ken's Tech Misadventures

transcript: - Oh, hey there kids. I was just about to log onto the information super highway. Oh, wait, where's my computer? Oh, right. I returned it for a full refund. Yes. Let's take a look. You guys went crazy over that episode. So what am I gonna do next? Of course, make a sequel. Because there's been some juicy developments going on. By the way, if you haven't seen the original episode I recommend checking that out first. Okay. So here's, what's been going on. Shortly after I posted the episode I received some DMs from people who claim to be working at the company or people who claimed to have worked at the company in the past. And they hinted at some not so good business practices and management practices, we'll just kind of put it plainly. I took that stuff with a grain of salt because anybody that leaves a company can say bad things about the company, if they left on bad terms especially, but it's still something I noted, especially because I had my own bad experience with the company from a customer end. So what caused this problem to happen? Well simply, I wanted to return the computer because it was kind of pricey. Let's be honest. and I didn't really have any more plans for it. And I wanted to return it before the return window closed on me. Now, before I bought their computer and I do this with everything, I checked the return policy and the terms seemed reasonable. You get a full refund except for the processing fee and maybe shipping or whatever. So you lose a little bit, but it's not bad. The problem was how you're supposed to return the product. When I scrolled down and notice you have to call a phone number to issue a return, I just knew it was gonna be a (bleep) show. I've never had to call to initiate a return. And the reason why I was concerned about that is because now there's a lot of human error that can happen with the return process. But here's where things got a little weirder. And this happened very early on. On November 18th is when I launched my episode, right? But I also noticed I had a refund in my bank account for $1,160 and 51 cents. It seems like they issued me a return, but I never asked for a return. So for a brief moment, I thought, "Wow, maybe they saw my episode. And they were like, whoa, give him his money back. He's not happy." But I took a closer look at the bank statement. That accidental refund was issued one day before I released the episode. So I have no idea why that happened. I never called them. I never emailed them. They never saw the episode, unless they were snooping around in my Patreon or something, so I don't know why they issued that refund. So I called them on November 26th and I was just being honest. I was like, "Hey guys, I don't know why you guys gave me a refund but I think it was an accident. Can we fix this?" And of course they had no problem taking the money back. Now at this time, I truly was not planning to do a return because I was still working with the computer. But when I officially decided I wasn't gonna do any more content regarding the computer, that that's when I decided to initiate the return later on. So in late November, I called them and I said, "Okay, hey guys, I would like to return the computer. How can I do this?" And they asked me to write the RMA number on the box. I've never been asked to do that before. It's usually a slip or it's usually filed somewhere on their website or wherever where they can read it. Didn't even have to put a label on. They were gonna send a guy out to the lair and pick it up. So I went to the surface, dropped it off and they picked it up. Seemed like it was working flawlessly. But then, I think it was on December 7th, I got a package. They sent the computer back to me. It was the exact same box. What the? So I called again, and this was a 50 minute phone call, most of it was me waiting on hold. We repeat the whole process and I put the box outside with the RMA number still on it. And then they picked it up and I haven't seen it since. So it looks like it actually mailed out correctly this time. But I'm waiting and waiting and I don't get my money back. So then I call them and these are the WOW! Computer/Journey Health guys that I normally call. But this time, even though I swear, I called Journey, they actually directly mentioned Telikin this time. And as you may remember, Telikin is the actual maker of this computer product and Journey Health I guess just slaps their logo on it and resells it. So this is the first time that was brought up. But then, I got put on another hold because I guess they had to transfer me from the Journey people to the Telikin people. So I'm waiting and waiting and waiting. And it says, you're number 10 in the queue. And I keep waiting and it says, you're number 10. And it says, you're number 10, you're number 10, probably five times. But it also said, press two, if you want to be called back. So I was like, okay, I press two. And the phone hung up. So it's, January's 6th now. I still didn't get a call back. So I went to the WOW! Computer website and the number I've been calling this whole time is in the return section of the website. And I was like, well, I'm getting nowhere with that. Let's call the number right on top. It seems like it's a general number, call it. And I get an error. We are unable to complete this call. So the number they have on the top of the website for everybody, to see just doesn't go anywhere. Very nice. So I go back to the number I was using previously, and this time it sounded like a different guy was talking and he actually sounded very knowledgeable. There was some hope building. He took care of everything. He didn't forward me to anybody else like a lot of other people did. And he said it would take four business days for the money to hit my bank. Five days went by, nothing happened. I still didn't have the money back in my bank account. It's January 13th at this point. This process has been going on since I believe November 23rd is when I made the first call. So we're almost two months into this process and still no resolution. So I waited another, I think eight days and there was still nothing in my bank. So I called them again and it sounded like I got the same guy as last time. His voice sounded the same. And just trying to put 'em in my shoes and be like, "Hey, would you want to wait two months for $1,200?" Like, that's a lot of money. Like you don't wanna be without that for a long time. And I was just trying to be, not pushy, not a Karen, but just trying to be assertive. Now it's January 27th, over two months since the whole thing started. Still no visible progress. So I thought, "Hmm, what if for some reason the box didn't make it there." So I checked the two tracking numbers that I had. And the second tracking number, didn't go to Virginia. So you should have it back to the account within 24 to 48 hours. - Okay. Good news. It looks like things were working. So now I'm checking my bank account like every few hours to see when it hits. Eh, no, it here's what I usually say to people. Even if a company, any company has a bad product or they made a mistake, good customer service can absolutely override that. I'm sure we've all had stories where we maybe had a bad product, but the customer service was so good, we gave the company another shot. So I really think customer service is the last line of defense and they can make it or break it for a company or a brand.
